chain_of_thought_reasoning: The question asks for the IDs of patients born in 1937 with total cholesterol (`T-CHO`) levels exceeding the normal range (>= 250). I will need to join the Patient and Laboratory tables to access both birth year and `T-CHO` data.  First, I need to filter patient records with birth year 1937. Then, filter the lab records where `T-CHO` >= 250. Finally, I need to join these two tables on patient ID and select patient IDs satisfying both conditions.
SQL: SELECT T1.ID FROM Patient AS T1 INNER JOIN Laboratory AS T2 ON T1.ID = T2.ID WHERE STRFTIME('%Y', T1.Birthday) = '1937' AND T2.`T-CHO` >= 250
SELECT T1.ID FROM Patient AS T1 INNER JOIN Laboratory AS T2 ON T1.ID = T2.ID WHERE STRFTIME('%Y', T1.Birthday) = '1937' AND T2.`T-CHO` >= 250

sql_generation.Question: List all patients who were born in 1937 whose total cholesterol was beyond the normal range.
sql_generation.Evidence: who were born in 1937 refers to year(birthday) = '1937'; total cholesterol was beyond the normal range refers to `T-CHO` > = '250'
sql_generation.pred_sql: SELECT T1.ID FROM Patient AS T1 INNER JOIN Laboratory AS T2 ON T1.ID = T2.ID WHERE STRFTIME('%Y', T1.Birthday) = '1937' AND T2.`T-CHO` >= 250
sql_generation.gold_sql: SELECT DISTINCT T1.ID FROM Patient AS T1 INNER JOIN Laboratory AS T2 ON T1.ID = T2.ID WHERE STRFTIME('%Y', T1.Birthday) = '1937' AND T2.`T-CHO` >= 250
